intro: Cologania broussonetii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and yellow, making it a popular ornamental plant. Cologania broussonetii thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
